questionText: Yeltsin promised free and democratic elections.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: In March 1996 Boris Yeltsin halted the offensive.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: During the Russian invasion 3600 Chechen civilians were killed.
author: A1C7UV2UT2S9T7

questionText: The withdrawal from Chechnya will be stage by stage.
author: A1C7UV2UT2S9T7

questionText: The 1994-96 war cost tens of thousands of lives.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: Russia maintained that Chechnya did not have the right to secede.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: In November 1999 Russia announced its intent to liberate all of Chechnya by February 2000.
author: A3L4JI1S352HB8

questionText: Russia sent troops to the Caucus region in December 1994.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: The Russians sent in some 30,000 troops to partition Chechnya.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Russians responded with all-out attempts to occupy Chechnya in 1994-96.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7
